amendatorysection.catchline: Enforcement; intergovernmental cooperation; employment of Department of Roads.
amendatorysection.para: It shall be the duty of the department, the Director of Aeronautics, and every state, county, and municipal officer, charged with the enforcement of state and municipal laws, to enforce and assist in the enforcement of the State Aeronautics Department Act, all rules and regulations issued pursuant thereto, and all other laws of this state relating to aeronautics. In the aid of such enforcement, general police powers are hereby conferred upon the Director of Aeronautics, and such of the officers and employees of the department as may be designated by it, to exercise such powers. The department is further authorized, in the name of this state, to enforce the act and the rules and regulations issued pursuant thereto by injunction in the courts of this state. Municipalities and persons owning privately owned public use airports are authorized to cooperate with the department in the development of aeronautics and aeronautical facilities in this state. The department may use the facilities and services of other agencies of the state to the utmost extent possible and such agencies are authorized and directed to make available such facilities and services. The department may also, with the approval of the Governor, contract with or employ the Department of Roads to maintain airports or perform necessary engineering service in carrying out the act.
